It is indeed the case, using the following function in the graph causes the segfault from 3e6e81da460f6f90d65c0def58a3538cfe106cda onwards.
```python
def dropout2(x, p = 1.0, training = False): # x is variable
    if not training:
        return x
    prob = x.mul(p)
    noise = torch.distributions.Bernoulli(1 - prob).sample().div(1 - prob)
    # noise = torch.bernoulli(1 - prob).div(1 - prob) # also segfaults
    return x * noise
```
